onboarding_welcome_subtitle: Daily activities for your baby's development
task_reg_001_step_1: Hold baby in your arms or place in a rocker
task_reg_001_step_2: Rock gently side to side or back and forth
task_reg_001_step_3: Hum or sing softly while rocking
task_reg_001_stop_if: Stop if baby seems distressed or overstimulated
task_reg_002_step_1: Lay baby on their back on a soft surface
task_reg_002_step_2: Apply gentle but firm pressure with your hands on chest and tummy
task_reg_002_step_3: Move to arms and legs with long, slow strokes
task_reg_002_step_4: Watch for signs of relaxation (softer body, slower breathing)
task_reg_002_stop_if: Stop if baby fusses or arches away
task_att_001_step_1: Show baby a black and white card at 12 inches from their face
task_att_001_step_2: Wait for baby to look at it (may take 5-10 seconds)
task_att_001_step_3: Slowly move the card left to right, watch if eyes follow
task_att_001_stop_if: Stop if baby looks away or loses interest
task_att_002_step_1: Sit baby in a supported position where they can see you
task_att_002_step_2: Cover your face with a light cloth and say 'Where's mommy/daddy?'
task_att_002_step_3: Pull cloth away and say 'Peek-a-boo!' with a big smile
task_att_002_stop_if: Stop if baby seems scared or upset
task_mot_001_step_1: Place baby on tummy on a firm surface
task_mot_001_step_2: Put a colorful toy slightly ahead and to the side
task_mot_001_step_3: Encourage reaching by moving toy slowly
task_mot_001_step_4: Cheer when baby moves arms or lifts head
task_mot_001_stop_if: Stop if baby fusses or seems tired (start with 2-3 minutes)
task_mot_002_step_1: Sit baby upright with support behind their back
task_mot_002_step_2: Hold favorite toy in front to encourage balance
task_mot_002_step_3: Gradually reduce support as baby maintains posture
task_mot_002_stop_if: Stop if baby slumps or seems frustrated
task_cau_001_step_1: Place a rattle in baby's hand
task_cau_001_step_2: Help them shake it if needed so they hear the sound
task_cau_001_step_3: Watch to see if baby shakes it themselves to make sound
task_cau_001_stop_if: Stop if baby drops toy and doesn't want it back
task_cau_002_step_1: Hold baby near a light switch (safely)
task_cau_002_step_2: Help baby's hand touch the switch to turn light on/off
task_cau_002_step_4: Watch for signs baby understands the connection
task_cau_002_stop_if: Stop after 5-6 repetitions or if baby loses interest
task_com_001_step_1: Hold baby where they can see your face (8-12 inches)
task_com_001_step_3: Narrate what you see: 'You're smiling!' or 'Big eyes!'
task_com_001_stop_if: Stop if baby looks away consistently
task_com_002_step_1: Wait for baby to make a sound (coo, babble, etc.)
task_com_002_step_2: Repeat the exact sound back to them
task_com_002_step_3: Pause and wait for baby to respond
task_com_002_stop_if: Stop if baby stops making sounds
task_ind_001_step_1: Start feeding with bottle as usual
task_ind_001_step_2: Guide baby's hands to hold the bottle
task_ind_001_stop_if: Provide support if baby drops bottle
task_ind_002_step_1: Give baby a small, easy-to-grip toy in one hand
task_ind_002_step_2: Offer a second toy to the same hand
task_ind_002_step_3: Watch to see if baby transfers first toy to other hand
task_ind_002_step_4: Celebrate when baby holds a toy in each hand
task_ind_002_stop_if: Stop if baby gets frustrated or drops toys repeatedly
